# The `SimplifyIndvar` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This is a utility for simplifying induction variables based on <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a>. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

This is a utility for simplifying induction variables based on <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a>.

It is the primary instrument of the IndvarSimplify pass, but it may also be directly invoked to cleanup after other loop passes that preserve <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a>.

Definition at line 53 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/simplifyindvar-cpp">SimplifyIndVar.cpp</a>.

### foldIVUser() {#a12f6125cdd608cb0459585ddb68ead53}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Value &#42; SimplifyIndvar::foldIVUser (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; UseInst, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; IVOperand)</>}>
Fold an IV operand into its use.

This removes increments of an aligned IV when used by a instruction that ignores the low bits.

IVOperand is guaranteed SCEVable, but UseInst may not be.

Return the operand of IVOperand for this induction variable if IVOperand can be folded (in case more folding opportunities have been exposed). Otherwise return null.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/simplifyindvar-cpp/#l00088">88</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/simplifyindvar-cpp">SimplifyIndVar.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### simplifyUsers() {#a1ba99155749ea6a41858f9bc4449f543}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void SimplifyIndvar::simplifyUsers (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/phinode">PHINode</a> &#42; CurrIV, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ivvisitor">IVVisitor</a> &#42; V=nullptr)</>}>
Iteratively perform simplification on a worklist of users of the specified induction variable.

This is the top-level driver that applies all simplifications to users of an IV.

Each successive simplification may push more users which may themselves be candidates for simplification.

This algorithm does not require <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ivusers">IVUsers</a> analysis. Instead, it simplifies instructions in-place during analysis. Rather than rewriting induction variables bottom-up from their users, it transforms a chain of <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ivusers">IVUsers</a> top-down, updating the IR only when it encounters a clear optimization opportunity.

Once DisableIVRewrite is default, LSR will be the only client of <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/ivusers">IVUsers</a>.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/simplifyindvar-cpp/#l00081">81</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/utils/simplifyindvar-cpp">SimplifyIndVar.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

Annotate BO with nsw / nuw if it provably does not signed-overflow / unsigned-overflow.

Returns true if anything changed, false otherwise.
